repos.description: A collection of reusable skills for Claude Code

plugins.name: git-plugin
plugins.description: Git worktree skill - Create isolated worktrees for PRs, branches, tags, or commits

skills.name: git-worktree
skills.description: Create isolated git worktrees for reviewing PRs, branches, tags, or commits without affecting main working directory.

frontmatter.name: git-worktree
frontmatter.description: Create isolated git worktrees for reviewing PRs, branches, tags, or commits without affecting main working directory.

skills.content:
# Git Worktree

## Scripts

**Setup:** `"${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/skills/git-worktree/setup-worktree.sh" --pr|--branch|--tag|--commit <VALUE>`
Options: `--editor skip` | `--editor-cmd <code|idea|claude>`

**Open main:** `"${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/skills/git-worktree/open-main-worktree.sh"`

**Cleanup:** `"${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/skills/git-worktree/cleanup-worktree.sh" --pr|--branch <VALUE>`
Options: `--yes` or `-y` (skip confirmation)

## Behavior

- Location: `../<project>.worktrees/<folder-name>`
- IDE auto-detection: VS Code, JetBrains, or Claude CLI
- Branch handling: local branches used directly, remote ‚Üí `worktree-branch-<name>`, PRs ‚Üí `worktree-pr-<number>`, tags/commits ‚Üí detached HEAD
- Windows: prefix with `bash` (requires Git Bash)

plugins.name: bitbucket-plugin
plugins.description: Bitbucket Cloud PR operations - List, review, and manage pull requests on Bitbucket Cloud (bitbucket.org)

skills.name: bitbucket-cloud
skills.description: Handle Bitbucket Cloud PR operations. Use for "PR", "pull request", "review" when repo is on bitbucket.org.

frontmatter.name: bitbucket-cloud
frontmatter.description: Handle Bitbucket Cloud PR operations. Use for "PR", "pull request", "review" when repo is on bitbucket.org.

skills.content:
# Bitbucket Cloud PR Operations

Use `mcp__plugin_bitbucket-plugin__*` MCP tools.

## Step 1: Detect Platform (REQUIRED)

Run `git remote -v` to identify platform:
- `bitbucket.org` ‚Üí ‚úÖ Bitbucket Cloud (continue)
- `bitbucket.<company>.com` or custom domain ‚Üí Use `bitbucket-datacenter` skill
- `github.com` ‚Üí Use `github-pr` skill

**Extract from URL:**
- SSH: `git@bitbucket.org:workspace/repo.git` ‚Üí workspace=`workspace`, repo=`repo`
- HTTPS: `https://bitbucket.org/workspace/repo.git` ‚Üí workspace=`workspace`, repo=`repo`

## Output Format

List PRs as table: `| # | Title | Author | Branch | Status | Updated |`
Status: ‚úÖ Open | üìù Draft | üîÄ Merged | ‚ùå Declined

## PR Review

1. Fetch PR details + diff
2. Analyze: bugs, security, performance, code quality
3. Present: `## PR Review: #<NUM> - <TITLE>` with Summary, Issues Found (`[file:line]`), Verdict (APPROVE/REQUEST_CHANGES/COMMENT)
4. Post comments/approve if requested

skills.name: bitbucket-datacenter
skills.description: Handle Bitbucket Data Center/Server PR operations. Use for "PR", "pull request", "review" when repo is on self-hosted Bitbucket (NOT bitbucket.org).

frontmatter.name: bitbucket-datacenter
frontmatter.description: Handle Bitbucket Data Center/Server PR operations. Use for "PR", "pull request", "review" when repo is on self-hosted Bitbucket (NOT bitbucket.org).

skills.content:
# Bitbucket Data Center PR Operations

Use `mcp__plugin_bitbucket-datacenter-plugin__*` MCP tools.

## Step 1: Detect Platform (REQUIRED)

Run `git remote -v` to identify platform:
- `bitbucket.<company>.com` or custom domain ‚Üí ‚úÖ Bitbucket DC (continue)
- `bitbucket.org` ‚Üí Use `bitbucket-cloud` skill
- `github.com` ‚Üí Use `github-pr` skill

**Extract from URL:**
- SSH: `git@bitbucket.company.com:7999/PROJ/repo.git` ‚Üí workspace=`PROJ`, repo=`repo`
- HTTPS: `https://bitbucket.company.com/scm/PROJ/repo.git` ‚Üí workspace=`PROJ`, repo=`repo`

## Output Format

List PRs as table: `| # | Title | Author | Branch | Status | Updated |`
Status: ‚úÖ Open | üìù Draft | üîÄ Merged | ‚ùå Declined

## PR Review

1. Fetch PR details + diff
2. Analyze: bugs, security, performance, code quality
3. Present: `## PR Review: #<NUM> - <TITLE>` with Summary, Issues Found (`[file:line]`), Verdict (APPROVE/REQUEST_CHANGES/COMMENT)
4. Post comments/approve if requested

skills.name: github-pr

frontmatter.name: github-pr
frontmatter.description: Handle GitHub PR operations. Use for "PR", "pull request", "review" when repo is on github.com.

skills.content:
# GitHub PR Operations

Use `mcp__plugin_github-plugin__*` MCP tools.

## Step 1: Detect Platform (REQUIRED)

Run `git remote -v` to identify platform:
- `github.com` ‚Üí ‚úÖ GitHub (continue)
- `bitbucket.org` ‚Üí Use `bitbucket-cloud` skill
- `bitbucket.<company>.com` or custom domain ‚Üí Use `bitbucket-datacenter` skill

**Extract from URL:**
- SSH: `git@github.com:owner/repo.git` ‚Üí owner=`owner`, repo=`repo`
- HTTPS: `https://github.com/owner/repo.git` ‚Üí owner=`owner`, repo=`repo`

## Output Format

List PRs as table: `| # | Title | Author | Branch | Status | Updated |`
Status: ‚úÖ Open | üìù Draft | üîÄ Merged | ‚ùå Closed

To exclude drafts, use search with `draft:false`.

## PR Review

1. Fetch PR details + diff
2. Analyze: bugs, security, performance, code quality
3. Present: `## PR Review: #<NUM> - <TITLE>` with Summary, Issues Found (`[file:line]`), Verdict (APPROVE/REQUEST_CHANGES/COMMENT)
4. Post comments/approve if requested

## Inline Review Comments

For reviews with inline comments: create pending review ‚Üí add inline comments ‚Üí submit with verdict.
